text: Nora Ephron (; Interview. May 19, 1941 – June 26, 2012)Telegraph obituary was an American movie director, producer and novelist. Ephron was the eldest of the four daughters of writers Henry Ephron (1911-1992) and Phoebe Ephron (née Wolkind, 1914-1971). Her sisters are Delia Ephron (born 1944), Hallie Ephron (born 1948) and Amy Ephron (born 1952). Nora Ephron was born in New York City and moved to Los Angeles, California when she was a child. She moved back East after leaving high school. She made many novels into movies. Ephron has been married to Nicholas Pileggi from 1987 until her death in 2012. Ephron died of pneumonia which was caused by her illness of acute myeloid leukemia. == References == == Other websites == * Category:American screenwriters Category:BAFTA Award winners Category:Deaths from acute myeloid leukemia Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Movie directors from California Category:Movie directors from New York (state) Category:Movie producers from California Category:Movie producers from New York (state) Category:Writers from Los Angeles Category:Writers from New York City Category:1941 births Category:2012 deaths Category:American bloggers
title: Nora Ephron
